## About Me

I am a PhD candidate in the *Bayesian Computational Statistics and Modeling Research Group* at King Abdullah University of Science and Technology (KAUST), under the supervision of Professor Håvard Rue.

My research focuses on *Bayesian latent variable models*, from *Prior Specification* to *model construction*.

### Education

* **PhD in Statistics** | King Abdullah University of Science and Technology, Saudi Arabia (2023-present)
* **MSc in Statistics** | Lancaster University, UK (2021-2022)
* **BSc in Applied Mathematics** | University of Liverpool & Xi’an Jiaotong‑Liverpool University, Suzhou, China (2017-2021)

### Research Interests

* **Hierarchical Bayesian latent variable modeling** – modeling unobservable structures and information underlying observed data
* **Probabilistic learning** – developing tractable and explainable probabilistic models for complex data
* **Prior specification** – designing principled prior construction and selection frameworks to improve model stability and inferential accuracy
* **Modeling variables on non-linear spaces** – developing methodology for statistical models involving variables defined on non-linear domains (e.g. manifolds)
* **Deep learning methodology** - developing accurate and efficient deep learning methods

### Publications

* Ye, X., Van Niekerk, J. and Rue, H., 2025. Principled priors for Bayesian inference of circular models. arXiv preprint arXiv:2502.18223.
